name: Aligned Thrust Variants
desc: Aligns turn controls to be forward focus, increasing the max speed of the ship by %s, but decreases the ships maneuverability by %s.

name: Beam Combiners
desc: Installs partial reflectors that combine two or more wavelengths of light on all beam weapons.

name: External Cargo Holds
desc: A merchant's cheap way of increasing profits and margins by attaching cargo to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: External Cryo Pods
desc: Puts crew, passengers or marines into cryostasis pods and attaches them to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: External Fuel Tanks
desc: A cheap way of extending expeditions by attaching fuel tanks or barrels to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: Flux Conduction Armor
desc: Replaces the ships armor with flux conductive materials allowing accumulated flux to be stored in the armor.

name: Front Loaded Armor
desc: An old domain armor modification that strengthens the ship's front armor, allowing it to last longer in face-to-face battles.

name: Fuel Ramscoop
desc: Installs a ramscoop that gathers interstellar matter that converts it into useable fuel.

name: Graviton Attunement Drive
desc: An experimental drive field that attunes the quantum gravitational energy surrounding each ship, accelerating them through space.

name: Hull Conversion
desc: Replaces specific hull bracings and bulkheads with high density metals, but compromises the ship's overall structural integrity.

name: Industrial Machine Forge
desc: A facility within the ship is converted into an industrial forge use for creating heavy machinery.

name: Makeshift Missile Autoforge
desc: A crude dedicated autoforge is installed on missile weapons that is only activated when running out of ammo.

name: Marine Training Facility
desc: A section of the ship is converted into a training facility for training marines and converting crew members into marines.

name: Reactive Shields
desc: Installs an optic focuser on the ship's shield emitter, condensing shield particles towards a focal direction or point.

name: Reactive Subsystems
desc: Replaces subsystems with reactive machines, a basic type of AI that only reacts to its given scenario but cannot go past it.

name: Redundant Machinery
desc: The duration of overloads and the time required to repair disabled engines and weapons are reduced by a factor of %s while the rate at which combat readiness degrades is reduced by %s, but increases the supplies used per month by %s.

name: Subverted Shields
desc: Installs an oscillator in the ship's shield emitter, vibrating shield particles, allowing flux to pass through.

name: Targeting Transceiver
desc: Increases non-missile weapons range by %s if installed on frigates or destroyers, or increases weapons autoaim accuracy by %s if installed on cruisers or capital ships. But effects are only active if a cruiser or capital ship is within %s and has a %s hullmod installed.

name: Temporal Flux Reactor
desc: A modified phase cloak that exploits the time dilation within phase-space without going into phase-space.

name: Test Hullmod
desc: Hullmod for testing purposes.

name: Test Stopwatch
desc: Hullmod for timing purposes.

name: Venting Overdrive
desc: An old domain venting protocol that overrides safety procedures when venting. Mostly used for armored ships that can tolerate the force applied when venting.

name: Volatile Warheads
desc: Replaces the chemicals within conventional missile warheads with volatile and radioactive chemicals.

name: Weapon Amplifiers
desc: Installs transistors and transformers to particularly improve the flux utilization of non-missile weapons.

name: Weapon Limiters
desc: Replaces resistors and diodes with a more effective alternative that improves flux management on ships.

name: Weapon Overclocks
desc: Modifies the rate of loading and firing of non-missile weapons while staying flux efficient when fired.
